definition: keeper of domestic animals/herdsman/(old) hired hand in certain trade

sentences.english: I have to disguise myself as a swineherd.
sentences.chinese: 我把自己伪装成一个猪倌。

sentences.english: everything to me." So the ladies were obliged to go to him again.
sentences.chinese: 这样，侍女们只得又到猪倌那儿去一趟。

sentences.english: The rain washed the dirty swineherd's face, and he turned into the beautiful prince.
sentences.chinese: 雨水冲刷了猪倌的面庞，猪倌变成了英俊的王子。

sentences.english: The rain washed the dirty swineherd's face, and he turned into the beautiful prince.
sentences.chinese: 雨水冲刷了猪倌的面庞，猪倌变成了英俊的王子。

sentences.english: So the ladies were obliged to go to him again.
sentences.chinese: 这样，侍女们只得又到猪倌那儿去一趟。

sentences.english: The prince, disguised as a swineherd, went to the princess' palace.
sentences.chinese: 假扮成猪倌的王子去了公主的宫殿。

sentences.english: The rain washed the dirty swineherd's face, and he turned into the beautiful prince.
sentences.chinese: 雨水冲洗了猪倌的肮脏的脸，转而变成了英俊的王子。

definition: to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
household with savings or annual income of 10,000 yuan or more (considered a large amount in the 1970s, when the term became established)
organizer of a gambling party who takes a cut of the winnings/banker (gambling)/preceding player (in a game)/(dialect) boss/proprietor
